  --title "v0.1.0 — Initial Public Release" \\
  --notes "$\(cat <<'EOF'
## Limpet v0.1.0 — Initial Public Release

Limpet is a high-precision network scanner using eBPF/XDP kernel-bypass timing for nanosecond-resolution SYN scanning.

### Features

- **eBPF/XDP kernel-bypass** — timestamps captured at the NIC driver level, bypassing the kernel network stack
- **Nanosecond RTT resolution** — sub-microsecond timing precision for network fingerprinting
- **SYN scanning** — stateless TCP SYN probing with kernel-level response capture
- **ML-ready output** — structured timing embeddings for downstream analysis pipelines
- **Ring buffer architecture** — lock-free BPF ring buffer for high-throughput packet capture

### Context

Limpet is the open-source scanning component of the [NullRabbit]\(https://nullrabbit.ai\) platform — autonomous defence for validator infrastructure and decentralised networks.

For the governance framework behind autonomous defensive action, see:

> **On Earned Autonomy: Delegating Network-Lethal Authority to Machines**
> Simon Morley, NullRabbit Labs, January 2026
> [DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.18406828]\(https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.18406828\)
EOF
\)")
